intro: Euphrasia officinalis var. salisburgensis, commonly known as the Salzburg eyebright, is a flowering plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the Orobanchaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in early summer. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and meadows. It has hairy leaves and is often found in regions with temperate climates. Its scientific name reflects its medicinal use, as it has been traditionally used in herbal medicine for eye health.
